snippet: Two briefs offer very different lessons about the decisions made in other countries.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column examines two amicus briefs that seek to leverage foreign legal opinion on same-sex marriage in order to influence Supreme Court, and Justice Anthony M Kennedy in particular, as it prepares to hear arguments on issue; notes first brief argues global consensus is in favor of such unions, while second says consensus supports gay rights, but not marriage.
lead_paragraph: Two briefs offer very different lessons about the decisions made in other countries.
